Mostly good, but one problem or question (details follow.) Good: great flexibility setting picture resolution and compression, which is why I chose this application over built-in camera app of Samsung S7. Here is my use case which is causing some question or problem (about handling FLASH setting): Question: I am not sure about how to use Flash AUTO mode. My application is mostly close-up still photographs in poor ambient light, so flash is necessary. I already have set "FOCUS BEFORE CAPTURE" on (this works.) If I set Flash ON, then photo is always over exposed. If I set Flash to AUTO, then there is two different results, which is possible problem. Problem: If I set flash AUTO (camera light will be on, like in flashlight mode) and immediately take photo, then result is good photo (proper light, proper exposure, proper focus). If I return to phone home screen, phone light source turns off. I then return to simple camera application, I see setting is still FLASH AUTO, however, in this case camera light is OFF, so next photograph does not have light from phone, only ambient light, and photo is not good. Work-around: For each photograph in this condition (close-up photo where focus is required and flash/light is required), I must remember to step through FLASH OFF, then FLASH ON, then FLASH AUTO, so that camera light is on before I take photo. Is this normal for software? It is my only problem - if I can find better method for using the software, I would give five ***** rating, because otherwise it is very nice application.

Good camera, but doesn't seem to support all modes my camera has. I'd still take it over my garbage HMD camera app any day. As well, clicking on the camera to focus is very off, about an entire centimetre below where I touched
